sprint_goal: Establish the core RBAC framework, user management, and foundational master data models (Driver, Customer, Vehicle) with basic views and validation.
epic_coverage: User and Access Management, Master Data Management
key_deliverables: Security groups & ACLs, User creation/role assignment, Driver model & view, Customer model & view, Vehicle model & view.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate Admin creating a new user and assigning a 'Dispatch Manager' role. Show creation of a new Driver, Customer, and Vehicle record, including validation.
success_criteria: All foundational models and security groups are in place. User creation and role assignment works as expected. RBAC is enforced at the model level.
risk_factors: RISK-005: Incorrect RBAC implementation. RISK-008: Key person dependency on backend developer.
mitigation_strategies: Early focus on security testing and pair programming for critical security logic.
burndown_target: Linear burndown, all critical path tasks completed by day 8.

sprint_goal: Harden the security model with record-level rules, build the core trip creation workflow, and implement vehicle document management foundations.
epic_coverage: User and Access Management, Trip Lifecycle Management, Master Data Management
key_deliverables: Driver record-level security rule, Field-level UI security, Core 'tms.trip' model and views, Vehicle document model and view, Scheduled action for expiry alerts.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a Driver can only see their own trips. Show a Dispatch Manager creating a new trip. Show an Admin attaching a compliance document to a vehicle.
success_criteria: Record rules and UI security are validated. Trip creation is fully functional. Vehicle document model is implemented.
risk_factors: RISK-005: High complexity in validating `ir.rule` for all edge cases.
mitigation_strategies: Dedicate significant QA time to security rule testing, leveraging automated integration tests.
integration_windows: Integration between trip and master data models.

sprint_goal: Finalize and validate the complete RBAC model, complete the trip assignment workflow, and configure S3 integration for document storage.
epic_coverage: User and Access Management, Master Data Management, Trip Lifecycle Management
key_deliverables: QA sign-off on RBAC, S3 integration for attachments, Fully functional trip assignment with validation and filtered resource lists.
demo_objectives: Show comprehensive RBAC validation by logging in as each role. Demonstrate S3 file upload for a vehicle document. Show a Dispatch Manager assigning a trip, including filtered dropdowns and capacity validation.
success_criteria: RBAC test matrix is 100% passed. S3 integration is functional and verified. Trip assignment is feature-complete.
risk_factors: RISK-003: DevOps expertise for S3/IAM configuration. RISK-005: Thoroughness of manual QA for RBAC.
mitigation_strategies: Pair DevOps engineer with a backend developer for S3 task. Allocate sufficient, uninterrupted time for QA's RBAC validation.
integration_windows: S3 integration testing window on days 3-5.
burndown_target: Complete DevOps task early to unblock QA.

sprint_goal: Launch the foundational Driver Portal: enable driver login, trip viewing, and implement the trip cancellation workflow for dispatchers.
epic_coverage: Driver Portal and Mobile Experience, Trip Lifecycle Management
key_deliverables: Mobile-friendly driver login page, Driver's trip list view with 'Current' and 'Past' trips, Trip cancellation workflow for dispatchers.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a user with the 'Driver' role logging in on a mobile device. Show the driver's trip list. Demonstrate a Dispatch Manager cancelling an assigned trip and the driver receiving a notification.
success_criteria: Driver login is secure and functional on mobile viewports. Trip list correctly filters and displays data. Trip cancellation workflow is complete.
risk_factors: Slight capacity overload. UI/UX complexity for mobile responsiveness. Risk of holiday season affecting team availability.
mitigation_strategies: Confirm team availability. Prioritize critical path tasks first. Allow for minor scope negotiation if overload becomes an issue.
integration_windows: API contract finalization between frontend and backend for portal endpoints on day 2.
